intro: Cistanthe salsoloides, commonly known as the sandmat, is a low-growing annual plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is well-adapted to drought conditions. Its growth habit and morphology make it a common weed in disturbed areas. Cistanthe salsoloides plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for small invertebrates in its native environments.
